review.title: “Great place”
review.pros: Pros – People, work , client were all very great. I find Saatchi Healthcare to be very professional. Highly recommend working there.
review.cons: Cons – Can't think of anything negative. There has been lots of changes going on so no one knows much about what the future holds.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – I dont have any advice or feedback to leadership at the moment. let's hope they continue winning new business in order to grow.

review.title: “A lot of restructuring”
review.pros: Pros – Opportunity for those with ambition
review.cons: Cons – job stress related to shifting work environment
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend – I'm not optimistic about the outlook for this company

review.title: “Great environment and people but be prepared to work advertising hours”
review.pros: Pros – Great environment, great people, able to use creativity, work as patient advocates and help people, and
review.cons: Cons – The hours are long and the appreciation factor for good work done is low. Currently on a promotion and raise freeze so it is difficult to advance within the company.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Promote from within and hire at lower levels

review.title: “Great creative support.”
review.pros: Pros – Great creative budgets to work with. Physically a nice office building to work in.
review.cons: Cons – Poor environment and process to develop innovative ideas and solutions.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Be more business and strategic minded to be leaders in industry for the client's sake.

review.title: “A good place for Creative Pharma.”
review.pros: Pros – Strong efforts are made to bring about GOOD creative work and to push the envelope, however, this always proves difficult in the Pharma industry. The people are amazing, friendly, supportive and amusing. Your relationships with your coworkers is about more than work. I've made some life long friends here, that no doubt I will work with again, further down the line. The building is prestigious, and the area is great. There used to be a good work hard, play hard culture here, but the play hard portion seems to have diminished in recent months. DTC Agency of the Year for the past few years.
review.cons: Cons – We work very long hours, in my experience this is due to management's inability to say 'no' to the client, making every project a fire drill. Despite our efforts, we receive little to no appreciation from management. We don't even get perks - pizza in the lobby does not count and $100 Amex cards for junior employees is just insulting. Senior Management is very isolated, and while they claim to be making work-life changes, life remains the same. My major issue here is their reluctance to promote, this may be a result of the economy, but it does little for the already low employee morale.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Keep your minions in the loop! Show appreciation, we work our butts off for you. Elevate those that prove worthy.

review.title: “It's decent”
review.pros: Pros – If your boss likes you and fights for you, you'll be taken care of. Also, it's small enough to have a family feel. The creative is ok, though the creatives are great.
review.cons: Cons – Account services is run awfully, no one asks questions or educates the client so you're often spinning your wheels for nothing. Also, communication is awful throughout.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Concentrate on making people feel valued a bit more.
